definition: to catch/to grapple with/to hold onto
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

it doesn't matter whether a cat is white or black; as long as it catches mice it's a good cat (variant of a Sichuanese saying used in a speech by Deng Xiaoping 鄧小平|邓小平[Deng4 Xiao3 ping2] in 1962, usually associated with his economic reforms starting in 1978, in which pragmatism was favored over ideological purity)
pinyin: bu4 guan3 bai2 mao1 hei1 mao1 , zhuo1 zhu4 lao3 shu3 jiu4 shi4 hao3 mao1
containing_words.word: 不管白貓黑貓，捉住老鼠就是好貓

sentences.english: He was surprised when he stole an exhibit from the museum.
sentences.chinese: 當他從博物館偷盜一件展品時被當場捉住。

sentences.english: Palmer knows that Drazen is holding Kimberly and wants him dead.
sentences.chinese: 帕默知道德拉贊一夥捉住了金姆，並且想要他的命。

sentences.english: He clutches my wrists, trying to pry my hands away.
sentences.chinese: 他捉住我的手腕，想要把我的手掰走。

sentences.english: Thus I caught two fishes as it were with one hook.
sentences.chinese: 這樣我像是用一隻釣鉤而捉住了兩條魚。

sentences.english: If they were to catch me, they would shoot me.
sentences.chinese: 假使有人捉住我，他們就會槍斃我。

sentences.english: It happened shortly after this that the Lion was caught by some hunters, who bound him by strong ropes to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 後來獅子被幾個獵人捉住，用粗繩捆綁倒在地上。

sentences.english: The night watchmen who apprehended the thief was praised for his vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 捉住小偷的守夜人因其警惕性而受到人們的讚揚。

sentences.english: " He reached across the table and took her hand in his own suddenly, squeezing it.
sentences.chinese: 他突然靠向餐桌捉住了麗的手，握在了自己的手中。

sentences.english: The thief was nobbled in the act.
sentences.chinese: 那個小偷當場就被捉住了。

sentences.english: I caught the insect by inverting my mug over it.
sentences.chinese: 我把茶缸倒過來捉住了那隻蟲子。

sentences.english: To capture lots of viewers, you need to have a well-designed navigation.
sentences.chinese: 爲捉住遊覽者，你需要有一個設計精良的導航。
該死的印第安人住捉住了他。

sentences.english: The hunters took a fox by a trap.
sentences.chinese: 獵人們設陷阱捉住一隻狐狸。

sentences.english: One day the person caught the pock , though it rebelled with strong howl and made great noise.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，牧人捉住小豬，牠大聲號叫，猛烈地抗拒。

sentences.english: Once the Shepherd caught the piggy, it howled loudly and disputed fiercely.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，牧人捉住小豬，它大聲號叫，猛烈地抗拒。

sentences.english: You can catch these insects by tempting them to fly into a trap.
sentences.chinese: 你可以引誘這些昆蟲飛進羅網從而捉住它們。

definition: to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch
the power of sb or sth evil/the clutches (of a bad person etc)
to overpower/to overwhelm/to subdue/to check/to control
to run away/to take to one's heels
